title: Successful Login with Valid Credentials
description: Verify that users can log in successfully using correct username and password with JWT authentication and role assignment.

steps.description: Navigate to login screen
Input valid username and password
Click on the login button
Verify that the user is authenticated with a valid JWT token
Verify user is redirected to the correct landing page based on their role (admin, supervisor, staff)

title: Login Failure with Invalid Credentials
description: Verify that login fails and appropriate error message is shown when incorrect username or password is provided.

steps.description: Navigate to login screen
Input invalid username or password
Click on the login button
Verify that login fails and error message related to invalid credentials is displayed
Verify that no JWT token is issued

title: Role-Based Access Control Enforcement
description: Verify that users can only access features according to permissions defined for their roles (admin, supervisor, staff).

steps.description: Login as Admin user
Verify Admin can access user management, system configuration, and all app functions
Logout, then login as Supervisor
Verify Supervisor can access reports, manage sessions, and view variances, but cannot access user management
Logout, then login as Staff
Verify Staff can scan items, verify quantities, and view history but has no access to reports or user management

title: Barcode Scanning Functionality
description: Verify barcode scanning correctly identifies items using expo-barcode-scanner on supported platforms.

steps.description: Navigate to barcode scanning screen
Scan a valid barcode corresponding to an existing item
Verify the scanned item details are displayed correctly
Scan an invalid or unregistered barcode
Verify an appropriate error or 'item not found' message is displayed

title: Verify Item Quantity Entry with Photo Proof
description: Verify that staff can enter stock quantities and attach photo proof to the verification record.

steps.description: Scan or select an item to verify
Input valid quantity for the item
Attach or capture a photo as proof
Save the verification
Verify the entered quantity is saved correctly
Verify photo proof is correctly attached and viewable

title: Handle Invalid Quantity Input During Verification
description: Verify the system handles invalid or negative quantities gracefully when staff try to enter them.

steps.description: Select an item for verification
Enter a negative or non-numeric quantity
Attempt to save the verification
Verify the system presents a validation error preventing the save

title: Variance Tracking Accuracy
description: Verify the variance between system stock quantities and verified quantities is calculated and displayed correctly.

steps.description: Verify quantities for multiple items with known stock and entered counts
Verify variance = verified quantity minus system stock quantity is correctly calculated for each item
Verify variances appear accurately in variance reports or views for supervisor and admin roles

title: CSV Export of Verification Data
description: Verify export functionality generates a correct CSV file containing verification data.

steps.description: Navigate to the verification data export feature
Perform export to CSV
Verify a CSV file is generated and downloaded or accessible
Verify the CSV file contents match current verification data including item details, quantities, variance, and timestamps

title: Offline Usage with Data Sync
description: Verify that users can perform scanning, verification, and data entry offline and that data syncs correctly when connectivity is restored.

steps.description: Simulate offline mode by disabling network connectivity
Perform barcode scanning and item quantity verification with photo
Verify data is saved locally and accessible while offline
Restore network connectivity
Verify that all offline data is synced to the server correctly

title: React Native Expo Router Navigation
description: Verify navigation flows correctly between screens using Expo Router on iOS, Android, and Web platforms.

steps.description: Launch app and navigate through login, scanning, verification, and report screens
Verify back and forward navigation works correctly without errors
Verify navigation state is preserved across platform-specific behaviors

title: Invalid JWT Token Handling and Session Expiry
description: Verify that the app properly handles expired or invalid JWT tokens by redirecting users to login and displaying relevant messages.

steps.description: Login and obtain valid JWT token
Simulate JWT expiry or token invalidation
Attempt to access secured features
Verify user is redirected to login screen
Verify an appropriate message is displayed about session expiry

title: Staff Access Restriction to Admin Features
description: Verify that staff users cannot access admin-only features such as user management and system configuration.

steps.description: Login as staff user
Attempt to navigate to user management and system configuration screens
Verify access is denied with an appropriate message or the features are not visible

title: Verify Photo Proof Upload Failure Handling
description: Check the system behavior when photo proof upload fails due to network or file errors.

steps.description: Attempt to attach a photo proof with simulated upload failure (e.g., network disconnected)
Try to save verification record
Verify an error message is shown explaining photo upload failure
Verify the verification is not saved without successful photo upload

title: Verify State Management Consistency using Zustand
description: Verify that application state changes are properly managed and persisted through Zustand across user interactions.

steps.description: Perform multiple state updates: scan items, enter quantities, attach photos
Verify that the state correctly reflects all updates and is consistent across components
Refresh or restart the app
Verify persisted state is restored correctly if implemented

title: App Compatibility Across iOS, Android, and Web
description: Verify that core app features including scanning, verification, and exporting work on iOS, Android, and Web platforms using Expo.

steps.description: Run the app on iOS device/emulator and perform barcode scanning, item verification, and CSV export
Verify all features work as expected without crashes or errors on iOS
Run the app on Android device/emulator and repeat the tests
Verify all features work as expected without crashes or errors on Android
Run the app on supported Web browser and repeat the tests
Verify features work as expected on web platform, considering scanning limitations on web
